svg.desc: Standards-compliant 12 V DC electrical schematic for a small yacht. Includes batteries, overcurrent protection, distribution, lighting, navigation and communications, NMEA 2000 (N2K), bilge systems, solar charging, and RF paths. Each element carries machine-readable IDs and metadata to support validation and automation in accordance with ABYC E-11 and ISO 13297. Structured for both human readability and programmatic parsing.

g.title: cable.ais.neg — dist.sw.navcom.term.neg.ais → load.ais.term.neg
cable.ais.pos — switch.ais.pin-3 → load.ais.term.pos; fuse.sw.navcom.ais
cable.bilge.auto.pos — dist.ao.house.term.pos.bilge.auto → load.bilge.term.auto.pos — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ISO 3.6 m / ABYC 3.1 m; fuse.ao.house.bilge.auto
cable.bilge.manual.pos — switch.bilge.pin-3 → load.bilge.term.manual.pos — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ISO 3.6 m / ABYC 3.1 m; fuse.ao.house.bilge.manual
cable.bilge.neg — dist.ao.house.term.neg.bilge → load.bilge.term.neg — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ISO 3.6 m / ABYC 3.1 m
cable.cabin.chart.neg — dist.sw.lights.term.neg.chart → load.chart.term.neg
cable.cabin.chart.pos — dist.sw.lights.term.pos.chart → load.chart.term.pos; fuse.sw.lights.chart
cable.cabin.down.neg — dist.sw.lights.term.neg.down → load.down.term.neg
cable.cabin.down.pos — dist.sw.lights.term.pos.down → load.down.term.pos; fuse.sw.lights.down
cable.gps.neg — dist.sw.navcom.term.neg.gps → load.gps.term.neg — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ISO 25.2 m / MFR 8 m
cable.gps.pos — dist.sw.navcom.term.pos.gps → load.gps.term.pos — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ISO 25.2 m / MFR 8 m; fuse.sw.navcom.gps
cable.mast.arw.pos — switch.mast.pin-5 → load.mast.term.pos.arw — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.arw
cable.mast.neg — dist.sw.lights.term.neg.mast → load.mast.term.neg — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG
cable.mast.tri.pos — switch.mast.pin-2 → load.mast.term.pos.tri — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.tri
cable.n2k.neg — dist.sw.navcom.term.neg.n2k → load.n2k.term.neg
cable.n2k.pos — dist.sw.navcom.term.pos.n2k → load.n2k.term.pos; fuse.sw.navcom.n2k
cable.combiner.85 — dist.ao.reserve.term.pos.combiner → combiner.term.85 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.ao.reserve.combiner
cable.combiner.86 — dist.ao.reserve.term.neg → combiner.term.86 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG
cable.feed.ais — dist.sw.navcom.term.pos.ais → switch.ais.pin-2 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.navcom.ais
cable.feed.bilge.manual.pos — dist.ao.house.term.pos.bilge.manual → switch.bilge.pin-2 — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG; fuse.ao.house.bilge.manual
cable.deck.feed.side.1 — dist.sw.lights.term.pos.side → switch.deck.pin-4 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.side
cable.deck.feed.side.3 — dist.sw.lights.term.pos.side → switch.deck.pin-6 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.side
cable.deck.feed.stern — dist.sw.lights.term.pos.stern → switch.deck.pin-1 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.stern
cable.mast.feed.arw — dist.sw.lights.term.pos.arw → switch.mast.pin-6 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.arw
cable.mast.feed.tri — dist.sw.lights.term.pos.tri → switch.mast.pin-1 — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.tri

g.title: cable.pv.ctrl.emergency.neg — pv.ctrl.emergency.term.out.neg → dist.ao.house.term.neg.pv-emergency — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ABYC 1 m
cable.pv.ctrl.emergency.pos — pv.ctrl.emergency.term.out.pos → dist.ao.house.term.pos.pv-emergency — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ABYC 1 m; fuse.ao.house.pv-emergency

cable.socket.r.pos — dist.ao.reserve.term.pos.socket → socket.12v.reserve.term.pos — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.ao.reserve.socket
cable.usb.h.neg — dist.ao.house.term.neg.usb → load.usb.h.term.neg — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG
cable.usb.h.pos — dist.ao.house.term.pos.usb → load.usb.h.term.pos — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.ao.house.usb
cable.usb.r.neg — dist.ao.reserve.term.neg.usb → load.usb.r.term.neg — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG
cable.usb.r.pos — dist.ao.reserve.term.pos.usb → load.usb.r.term.pos — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.ao.reserve.usb
cable.pv.panel.emergency.adapter.neg — connector.pv.emergency.neg → pv.ctrl.emergency.term.in.neg
cable.pv.panel.emergency.adapter.pos — connector.pv.emergency.pos → pv.ctrl.emergency.term.in.pos
cable.pv.panel.emergency.neg — pv.panel.emergency.term.neg → connector.pv.emergency.neg
cable.pv.panel.emergency.pos — pv.panel.emergency.term.pos → connector.pv.emergency.pos
SureSeal receptacle/socket
cable.pv.panel.house.neg — pv.panel.house.term.neg → pv.ctrl.house.term.in.neg — ISO 1.5 mm² — ABYC 16 AWG — Lmax ISO 4.8 m / ABYC 4.2 m

cable.rte.neg — dist.sw.navcom.term.neg.rte → load.rte.term.neg — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG
cable.rte.pos — dist.sw.navcom.term.pos.rte → load.rte.term.pos — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.navcom.rte
cable.side.neg — dist.sw.lights.term.neg.side → load.side.term.neg — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG
cable.side.pos — switch.deck.pin-2 → load.side.term.pos — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.side
cable.stern.neg — dist.sw.lights.term.neg.stern → load.stern.term.neg — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG
cable.stern.pos — switch.deck.pin-5 → load.stern.term.pos — ISO 0.75 mm² — ABYC 18 AWG; fuse.sw.lights.stern
cable.tiller.neg — dist.ao.reserve.term.neg.tiller → socket.tiller.term.pin2 — ISO 2.5 mm² — ABYC 14 AWG — Lmax ISO 4.9 m / ABYC 4.3 m / MFR 4 m
cable.tiller.pos — dist.ao.reserve.term.pos.tiller → socket.tiller.term.pin1 — ISO 2.5 mm² — ABYC 14 AWG — Lmax ISO 4.9 m / ABYC 4.3 m / MFR 4 m; fuse.ao.reserve.tiller
cable.vhf.neg — dist.sw.navcom.term.neg.vhf → load.vhf.term.neg
cable.vhf.pos — dist.sw.navcom.term.pos.vhf → load.vhf.term.pos — fuse.sw.navcom.vhf

g.title: cable.subfeed.combiner.30 — dist.ao.reserve.term.pos → combiner.term.30 — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG — Lmax ABYC 1 m; fuse.batt.reserve
cable.subfeed.combiner.87 — dist.ao.house.term.pos → combiner.term.87 — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG — Lmax ABYC 1 m; fuse.batt.house
cable.subfeed.lights.pos — selector.house.term.output → dist.sw.lights.term.pos — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG; fuse.batt.house
cable.subfeed.navcom.pos — selector.house.term.output → dist.sw.navcom.term.pos — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG; fuse.batt.house

cable.subfeed.reserve.pos — dist.ao.reserve.term.pos → selector.house.term.2 — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG; fuse.batt.reserve

cable.main.house.pos — dist.batt.house.term.load → dist.ao.house.term.pos — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG — Lmax ISO 3.3 m / ABYC 3.3 m; fuse.batt.house

cable.main.reserve.pos — dist.batt.reserve.term.load → dist.ao.reserve.term.pos — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG — Lmax ISO 2.4 m / ABYC 2.5 m; fuse.batt.reserve
neg-bridge-reserve-house.1 — dist.ao.reserve.term.neg → dist.sw.lights.term.neg — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG
neg-bridge-reserve-house.2 — dist.sw.lights.term.neg → dist.sw.navcom.term.neg — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG
neg-bridge-reserve-house.3 — dist.sw.navcom.term.neg → dist.ao.house.term.neg — ISO 6 mm² — ABYC 10 AWG
cable.mrbf.house — batt.house.term.pos → dist.batt.house.term.batt
cable.mrbf.reserve — batt.reserve.term.pos → dist.batt.reserve.term.batt
cable.rf.ais-antenna — load.ais.term.rf.out → antenna.vhf.term.rf

g.data-navlights: [{"P_total_W":3.3,"colregs":"Rule 25 (sailing vessel) — sidelights + sternlight","lights":["side","stern"],"mode":"Sail (Deck) - Emergency","sw":{"deck":"UP","mast":"CTR"}},{"P_total_W":3.3,"colregs":"Rule 23 (<12 m) — all-round white + sidelights","lights":["arw","side"],"mode":"Engine","note":"<12 m: all-round + sidelights","sw":{"deck":"DOWN","mast":"DOWN"}},{"P_total_W":1,"colregs":"Rule 30 — all-round white","lights":["arw"],"mode":"Anchor","sw":{"deck":"CTR","mast":"DOWN"}},{"P_total_W":1.9,"colregs":"Rule 25 — tricolor permitted (<20 m)","lights":["tri"],"mode":"Sail (Mast)","sw":{"deck":"CTR","mast":"UP"}},{"P_total_W":0,"colregs":"—","lights":[],"mode":"Off","sw":{"deck":"CTR","mast":"CTR"}}]

cc:Work.dc:description: Machine-readable, standards-compliant 12 V DC electrical schematic for a small yacht (e.g., a Globe 5.80). Includes fully documented sources, protective devices, conductor sizing and length limits, switching, NMEA 2000 networking (N2K), solar charging, navigation/communications, lighting, and bilge circuits. Structured with consistent identifiers and metadata to support AI interpretation, automation, and validation under ABYC E-11 and ISO 13297.
cc:Work.dc:rights: © 2025 Olaf Koepke — MIT License. Provided “as is” for general information and not as professional advice or certification. Verify against current ABYC/ISO standards and manufacturer documentation before use. No warranties are expressed or implied; the author is not liable for loss, damage, injury, or noncompliance.
cc:Work.dc:title: AI-ready 12 V DC wiring layout for a small yacht (Globe 5.80 example)

compliance.refs: ABYC A-16,ABYC E-11,ClassGlobe 580 Class Rules,COLREGs,EN ISO 10133,EN ISO 13297,Offshore Special Regulations

sizes.authorities: ABYC E-11 Table IV-A|EN ISO 13297 Annex A

titles.cable-format: {id} — {from} → {to}{ — ISO {mm2} mm²}{ — ABYC {awg}}{ — Lmax ISO {m.iso} m / ABYC {m.abyc} m / MFR {m.mfr} m}{; fuse.{fuseid}}

design-goals.items: minimize cabling; minimize components; prefer device-integrated switching; minimize user operation; ensure standards compliance

svg.title: AI-ready 12 V DC wiring layout — Small yacht (Globe 5.80 example)
